entry.title: 1.The Geometry of Linear Equations
CHAPTER 1 The Machine Learning Landscape
entry.content:
PDF

Run directlty

google colab[1]

Summary

  1. about online learning

    if you have limited computing resources: once an online learning system has learned
    about new data instances, it does not need them anymore, so you can discard them.

  2. about learning rate

    it’s a kind of state transformer

    One important parameter of online learning systems is how fast they should adapt to
    changing data: this is called the learning rate. If you set a high learning rate, then your
    system will rapidly adapt to new data, but it will also tend to quickly forget the old
    data.

  3. learning by heart

    this kind of leaning is only learning by memory, just like some human’s learning, only can reproduce what it memorized.

    this kind of learning is lack abstract ability, data in ,data out.

    so In my learning progress, a pretty important aspect is abstract ability. From specification to abstract.

  4. similarity function

    This method is used in style transform, and word embedding. But they are model based learning.

  5. data && algorithm && iteration

    what we can know from this picture, just the relationship of data and algorithm, more than this is that we must notice a ting detail, the iteration.

    So what I want to talk about is generalize it to human been,there a lot of people search for a good method then they start to learn, but it is false, if we contrast human’s learning method and trained model weight. we can know even we start from scratch ,we can reach a pretty high performance finally, and in the learning process, we are continue to tweak our learning method to adapt our self, it’s a kind of self optimum.

    What caused most of people failure is the iteration, they haven’t insist on the last.

  6. sampling noise and sampling bias

  7. Cross validation

  1. tweaked version to adapt google colab from ageron ↩︎

categories.category: Hands On Machine Learning with Scikit Learn and TensorFlow

entry.title: CHAPTER 7 Ensemble Learning and Random Forests
entry.content:
PDF

Voting Classifier

Keypoint

  • as soon as possible to train independent classifiers,otherwise they will make the same error
  • make sure not to train on the same data. furthermore not train on the same distribution’s data
  • to train them using very different algorithm
  • let them make very different types of errors.

Main idea

The law of large number definition6.2.1

Combine original text

The probability of single classifier is barely better than random guessing,but what we focused isn’t the the classifier’s precision.Nevertheless we focused on the truth that the classifier is bit lead to expected result than the other one, when we sample thoundsands classifiers and then the frequency of barely expected results is much close to 1.

Code analysis

change how your Python module is parsed[1]

np lib is for create matrix,or generate random number,os lib is for python to operate path,and matplotlib is used to plot math function.

rc is abbreviation of runtime configuration[2]

create two help function for save img

difine some variable

start toss

make cumulative sum[3] and reshape automatically[4]

Open two subplot[5] wich sharing x axis.

set plot size(whole subplot)[6]

drawing baseline respective for guess and expectation.

plot head ration[7]

plot the probability of obtaining a majority of heads

after toss 990000

Prerequisite

The assume criterion must low than the Expectation value,other wise the the result will not converge to 1
criterion == guess == 0.34 == expectation = 0.34
criterion == guess == 0.34 < expectation = 0.35
criterion == guess == 0.34 > expectation = 0.33

  • criterion == expectation
  • criterion < expectation
  • criterion > expectation

We can conclude that the most critical relation is none about the guess probability,nevertheless it’s deceided by and criterion

Run code oneline

directly run in google colab,forked from ageron[8], but add some vision features and fixed path problem to adapt google colab.

unfinished part[9]:

unfinished part

Comprehension

Blind men and an elephant

First, we talk about an ancient parable Blind men and an elephant

A group of blind men heard that a strange animal, called an elephant, had been brought to the town, but none of them were aware of its shape and form. Out of curiosity, they said: “We must inspect and know it by touch, of which we are capable”. So, they sought it out, and when they found it they groped about it. In the case of the first person, whose hand landed on the trunk, said “This being is like a thick snake”. For another one whose hand reached its ear, it seemed like a kind of fan. As for another person, whose hand was upon its leg, said, the elephant is a pillar like a tree-trunk. The blind man who placed his hand upon its side said the elephant, “is a wall”. Another who felt its tail, described it as a rope. The last felt its tusk, stating the elephant is that which is hard, smooth and like a spear.

Read the story again

  • The situation is blind man to recognize this stange animal.
  • The manner that they to recognize is touch.
  • The initial memory about this stange animal is none.
    • The first person groped its trunk ,then he pridicts it as an thick snake.
    • The second person groped its ear,then he pridicts it as a kind of fan.
    • The third person groped its leg,then he pridicts it as a tree-trunk.
    • The fourth person groped its side,then he prdicts it as a wall.
    • The fifth person groped its tail,then he pridicts it as a rope.
    • The last person groped its tusk,then he pridicts it as a spere.

But if we gattered them pricits, we will get a much better predict about how does the elephant look like.

Tweak the story

  • The situation is precitor to recognize this training dataset.
  • The manner that they to recognize is fitting model.
  • The initial trained weights about this dataset is none.
    • The first precitor fit on subset 1 of training dataset ,then he pridicts it as an thick snake.
    • The second precitor fit on subset 2 of training dataset,then he pridicts it as a kind of fan.
    • The third precitor fit on subset 3 of training dataset,then he pridicts it as a tree-trunk.
    • The fourth precitor fit on subset 4 of training dataset,then he prdicts it as a wall.
    • The fifth precitor fit on subset 5 of training dataset,then he pridicts it as a rope.
    • The last precitor fit on subset 6 of training dataset,then he pridicts it as a spere.

But if we simply sum these result,we can get a much better performance with it.

Prerequisites

Story Task
The elephant is a real elephant, not a dog or cat. the gourd truth[GT] is none error in it.
The error is comes from misunderstand the model is underfitting.
Each person only recognized partial of the elephant Each predictor is trained at subset dataset

Advantage than single person/pridictor

  • parallel mission, more efficient.
  • more comprehensive information
  • more close to the truth.

The third point of multi-predictor is more close to truth is due to each predecessor has refined the origin dataset,and extract more useful feature correlated to the judgments based,and deprecat the rest of uncorrelated feature.Based on these information, we can make a better precition.Furthermore we can use these new feature to train a new model rather than simply sum them,and that may give us a better prediction.

Bad advice versus handcraft mislabel

Let’s talk about a satuation,the suject is you.One day,you want to learn machine learning, and asked thousands of random people,different people give different advice.

  • The first people told you machince learning need a good mathmatical basics, otherwise you can’t make sense anthing.
  • The second people told you can learn from scratch even you have no basic in it before.
  • The third people told you can use Coursera to learn ML.
  • The fouth told you hurry give up,it’s unpossible to learn it by your condition.
  • some people told you needn’t prepare a good mathmatics as prerequisite,just figure out some detail when you come across it.
  • some people mook you such ignorance.
    …
    Look there are lots of advice, does all of them be a good advice,the answer is NO!But more important thing is finally we still can reach the correct direction, even there much misleading in it.we still can figure out how to learn machine learning.

But the question is how we did it?

if we can figure out how we learn some thing from misleading information,then we can train our model in a mislabeled dataset,as I think.

According my comprehension,the reason is two aspect

  1. inspiration
  2. the misleading advice/mislabel dataset is positive correlation to the important advice/feature

Why do people discourage others?[10]

  • 1) They can’t do what you want to do:
    If i believe that i can’t succeed then i will assume that other people won’t be able to succeed as well unless they are lucky. Now when i meet an enthusiastic person who claims that he can succeed i will certainly try to infect him with my negative beliefs.
  • 2) They were threatened by you:
    Some people feel threatened whenever they find anybody trying to do something that they never dared to do. If someone always wanted to be rich but never dared to start a private business then he will feel threatened if he found you taking this step. In such a case this person might put you down just to make sure that you won’t bypass him and become better than him
  • 3) They are jealous:
    Believe it or not, a close friend may try to discourage you just because he is jealous of you. If you are getting more attention than him or if he feels incompetent compared to you then he might put you down just because he feels jealous
  • 4) He is afraid:
    When i proposed my first book to the owner of a publishing house back in 2006 the man refused to publish it claiming that he only publishes books about politics. Later on when i sold more than 1 million worth of copies (see How i did it) i realized that the man was just afraid to take the risk because i seemed young and so he chose to put me down
  • 5) They hate you: If a person hates you he wont want to see you succeeding at anything and that’s why he will try to discourage you whenever he gets the chance. Beware of enemies who come disguised as friends (see Dealing with people who hate you at work)
  • 6) They are not well informed:
    Many people hate to say “I don’t know” when they are asked about something. When people lack sufficient knowledge about what you are planning to do they might put you down just not to say “I don’t know”
  • 7) They can’t see the full picture: some people will put you down just because they can’t see the full picture you saw. Those people might have good intentions but in the end they will do the same harm that others who bad intentions did
By M.Farouk Radwan, MScWhy do people discourage others

So we can take such manner to treat these information

  • You can’t do it,it’s impossible. means You can do it.
  • You can’t learn machine learning forever,because you such bad in math. means as long as you improve you math,you can do a pretty good job in it,Go,GO,GO!!!

Does these make much sense?

Back to our mislabeled dataset

Let me ask you some question,what’s the reason of mislabel?

  • Due to these parts is more important than others.
  • These features are more easy to make fault even for human.
  • These part is what we called “Vehicle blind spot”.

we can’t realize each part of the reason why human make fault,but we can just put these to a Neural Network and let it figure out the reason.

What’s the target of training model?

  • we want to extract the most import,or most correlated feature.

These mislabel feature told model which part is more important, if we can just penalize these feature’s weight and argument the opposite feature(if we can do it).

Appendix

NexT.Pisces v7.0.1 seems not support Markdown Footnotes

Add pangu support

Can footnotes be integrated into Next | 引用链接效果做成像论文那样 #517

https://www.npmjs.com/package/hexo-footnotes

markdown footnote

Strikethrough

how to use codeblock tag-plugins

  1. What is future in Python used for and how/when to use it, and how it works ↩︎

  2. runtime configuration file ↩︎

  3. cumulative sum ↩︎

  4. -1 in reshape ↩︎

  5. subplot in matplotlib ↩︎

  6. how to set picture size when we use subplot ↩︎

  7. how to set subplot title ↩︎

  8. ageron github ↩︎

  9. Feature request: fold the code [solved] ↩︎

  10. Why do people discourage others? ↩︎

Joint Optic Disc and Cup Segmentation Based on Multi-label Deep Network and Polar Transformation
ImageNet Classification with Deep Convolutional
Man is to Computer Programmer as Woman is to Homemaker?
PCA-aided Fully Convolutional Networks for Semantic Segmentation of Multi-channel fMRI
Probability and statistics
Sample and Sampling distribution
entry.content:
常用统计量

sample mean:

X‾=1n∑i=1nXi\overline X = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}X_i X=n1​i=1∑n​Xi​

未修正的样本方差:

S02=1n∑i=1n(Xi−X‾)2S_0^2 = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}(X_i-\overline X)^2 S02​=n1​i=1∑n​(Xi​−X)2

样本方差:

S2=1n−1∑i=1n(Xi−X‾)S^2=\frac{1}{n-1}\sum_{i=1}^{n}(X_i-\overline X) S2=n−11​i=1∑n​(Xi​−X)

样本的K阶原点矩:

Ak=1n∑i=1nXik(一阶原点矩就是均值)A_k= \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}X_i^k (一阶原点矩就是均值) Ak​=n1​i=1∑n​Xik​(一阶原点矩就是均值)

样本K阶中心距:

Bk=1n∑i=1n(Xi−X‾)k(二阶中心矩就是未修正的样本方差)B_k = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}(X_i-\overline X)^k (二阶中心矩就是未修正的样本方差) Bk​=n1​i=1∑n​(Xi​−X)k(二阶中心矩就是未修正的样本方差)

协方差:

S12=1n∑(Xi−X‾)(Yi−Y‾)S_{12}=\frac{1}{n}\sum(X_i - \overline X)(Y_i-\overline Y) S12​=n1​∑(Xi​−X)(Yi​−Y)

相关系数:

R=S12S1∗S2R=\frac{S_{12}}{S_1*S_2} R=S1​∗S2​S12​​

样本均值和样本方差的性质

entry.title: English Booming plan
entry.content:
About my vocabulary

Here is the problem that my vocabulary is such lower than local English user, so something to me is hard to achieve, for example my reading ability is so bad that in my CET test only get 165~171.

These books list here are already read.

Date Book’s Name
6/15/2020~6/16/2020 Lost Treasure of the Emerald Eye
6/17/2020 The Curse of the Cheese Pyramid
6/18/2020 Cat and Mouse in a Haunted House
6/19/2020 I’m Too Fond of My Fur!
6/20/2020~6/21/2020 Back in Time

I know these things are not enough,I need more thing to do to improve my English writing ability,so there are my plan,I need to figure out some methods to solve this problem,I want to use the book “On writing well” to improve my English.
